hsrt.mec.controldeveloper.core.com

Interface IComListener


  • public interface IComListener
    Interface IComListener defines the listener which is called by the ComHandler object when a command of the execution process is executed.

    The class that is interested in being informed implements this interface, and the object created with that class is registered with the ComHandler object, using the objects ComHandler.register(IComListener) method. When a new command is executed out of the control process, that object's commandPerformed(ICommand, int) method is invoked.
    See Also:
    ComHandler

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void commandPerformed(ICommand c, int comHandlerState)
      Invoked when a command is executed.

    • Method Detail

      • commandPerformed

        void commandPerformed(ICommand c,
                    int comHandlerState)
        Invoked when a command is executed. With comHandlerState one of the following values from class ComHandler is returned:
        - ComHandler.CONNECTION_ERROR - ComHandler.ROVER_IS_USED - ComHandler.SEND_ICOMMAND - ComHandler.ROVER_RUNNING_ICOMMAND - ComHandler.ROVER_FINISH_ICOMMAND - ComHandler.ROVER_RECEIVE_ICOMMAND - ComHandler.ROVER_NOT_SELECTED
        Parameters:
        c - Information of the executed command.
        comHandlerState - Constant from ComHandler
